name: Bristol
fun_fact: Fun fact: Bristol is known as England's cider capital, and The Coronation Tap pub is at least 30 years older than the Clifton Suspension Bridge! This legendary cider house has existed for over 200 years and serves Exhibition Cider so strong it's only sold in half pints. The pub was named Southwest's 'Best Live Music Pub' and has a phenomenal global reputation among cider lovers.

hero_dishes.name: Pieminister Pies
hero_dishes.description: Award-winning British pies including the Moo & Blue (steak and stilton), served with mash and gravy
hero_dishes.origin_story: One of Bristol's most-loved local businesses that started in Bristol and now has branches across the city. Their original location in St Nicholas Market remains a local favorite
hero_dishes.where_to_find: St Nicholas Market (the original location) and multiple branches across Bristol - a true Bristol institution

hero_dishes.name: Sunday Roast
hero_dishes.description: Traditional British Sunday dinner with roasted meat, Yorkshire puddings, roast potatoes, seasonal vegetables, and rich gravy
hero_dishes.origin_story: A quintessentially British tradition where families and friends gather for a leisurely Sunday meal. Bristol takes this seriously with many pubs competing for the best roast in town
hero_dishes.where_to_find: The Ox (steakhouse since 2013, known for best steak and Sunday roast in Bristol), The Ostrich (harbourside pub), The Gallimaufry (local's favourite)

hero_dishes.name: Korean Tongdak at Bokman
hero_dishes.description: Wood-fire roasted chicken stuffed with sticky rice, served with Korean banchan (side dishes)
hero_dishes.origin_story: Bokman opened on Stokes Croft in 2019 and was immediately applauded as a 'modest but wholly authentic restaurant' serving some of the best Korean food in the UK. Named one of the Good Food Guide's Best Local Restaurants
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Bokman on Stokes Croft - a neighbourhood gem that locals love for its authenticity

hero_dishes.name: Wilsons Seasonal Tasting Menu
hero_dishes.description: Super seasonal, thoughtful tasting menu with produce grown in their own market garden, showcasing Modern British cuisine
hero_dishes.origin_story: Considered the best restaurant in Bristol by many. Chef Jan Ostle and team grow a substantial chunk of their produce in their own market garden in Redland
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Wilsons in Redland - a small, whitewashed restaurant that's a true neighbourhood gem

signature_drinks.name: Exhibition Cider
signature_drinks.description: Super-strong traditional scrumpy cider exclusive to The Coronation Tap, so potent it's only served in half pints
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Locals (especially students) make pilgrimages to The Cori next to Clifton Suspension Bridge. The strong cider is sipped slowly in half-pint measures while enjoying live music

signature_drinks.name: Thatchers Cider
signature_drinks.description: Now the most popular cider in the UK, Thatchers Gold cider is brewed just outside Bristol in Sandford, North Somerset
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Available throughout Bristol's pubs. Locals can visit the Thatchers orchards and farm for tours and tastings, or drink it at their pub The Railway Inn

signature_drinks.name: Perry (Pear Cider)
signature_drinks.description: Refreshing cider made from pears instead of apples, a West Country specialty
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Bristol pubs like The Orchard Inn (Bristol's original cider pub dating to 1834) offer 20+ ciders and perries from West Country producers

food_culture_notes: Bristol is known for balloons, Banksy, colourful houses, and cider - the clichÃ© is true, Bristolians love their cider
Different neighbourhoods have distinct food cultures: St Mark's Road in Easton for Middle Eastern/South Asian, St Pauls and Stokes Croft for Caribbean, Clifton for classic British and seafood
The Orchard Inn by the Marina has been awarded 'CAMRA Regional Cider Pub of the Year' many times, always offering 20+ ciders from West Country producers
The Coronation Tap dates to at least 1806, described as 'a beerhouse with cottage adjoining' and was chosen as a finalist for UK Music Pub of the Year 2009-2011
St Nick's Market offers fantastic street food from independent vendors; Wapping Wharf has indie traders in shipping containers
Bulrush in Cotham has a Michelin Star for Modern British cuisine with Japanese influences, using organic and foraged seasonal ingredients
The Clifton Sausage serves comforting British classics: sausages, mashed potato and gravy with vegetarian options

unique_modern: 200-year-old pub next to engineering marvel bridge
